Authors:
Toshimitsu FUKIHARU, Thao Phuong Nguyen, Kiminori
SHIMIZU
Title:
Parasola neoplocatilis sp. nov. (Basidiomycota, Agaricales,
Psathyrellaceae) from Chiba and Toyama, Central Japan.
Abstract:
Parasola neoplicatilis (Basidiomycota, Agaricales,
Psathyrellaceae) is described as a new coprinoid fungus from Chiba and
Toyama Pref., Japan. In macro- and micro-morphology, this species is
similar to P. kuehneri but differs in basidiospore morphology: shape is
more rhomboid or mitriform and also rostrated at the base (around
apiculus). This distinct basidiospore shape differentiates this species
from all other Parasola species. The results of phylogenetic analysis
with the ITS data also support this new taxon.
